<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_from_pipe:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_pipe (int fd)
{
  struct MHD_Response *response;

  response = MHD_create_response_from_callback (MHD_SIZE_UNKNOWN,
                                                MHD_FILE_READ_BLOCK_SIZE,
                                                &pipe_reader,
                                                NULL,
                                                &free_callback);
  if (NULL == response)
    return NULL;
  response->fd = fd;
  response->is_pipe = true;
  response->crc_cls = response;
  return response;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Only fragments that involve function calls or callback function pointers can lead to direct or indirect recursion and therefore must be investigated for compliance with Rule 17.2. The assignment to 'response' via a call to MHD_create_response_from_callback and the callback pointers passed (&pipe_reader and &free_callback) are the relevant items: MHD_create_response_from_callback may call back into other functions (potentially MHD_create_response_from_pipe) via these callbacks or via other calls it makes. Other lines in the function do not perform function calls or pass function pointers and therefore cannot introduce direct or indirect self-calls: the function header and local declaration, the null-check and return, the simple assignments 'response->fd = fd;', 'response->is_pipe = true;', and 'response->crc_cls = response;' do not invoke functions and thus are not relevant to Rule 17.2.
